programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Staffordshire compete to win the £1,000 prize, beginning with Jodie and Ben who hope their risky starter of lamb tartare pays off. Dave and Sian prepare a more traditional menu on the second evening, including a bread and butter pudding, and surprise the contestants with musical entertainment. Straight-talking Michelle is the last to host with Matt, but she could have already blown their chances of winning.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south east London, Nathan and manageress Debbs consider a deal on two vintage saxophones, and deliver a surprise when valuing an antique Japanese helmet.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book, and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Aberdeen to help two sets of house hunters who have relocated to the city for work and need to find family homes quickly. Helen Barr and Brian Clarence moved from Essex while awaiting the arrival of their first child and have been living in rented accommodation, but with baby number two on the way, it's time to find a family home. However, Brian's main priority seems to be finding a bargain, while Helen doesn't want to take on a project. Meanwhile, Kirstie helps Kirsten and Scott Laing search for a semi-rural property so they can move their family up from Fife.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps more home-buyers find a balance between town and country, including Sue and Richard from West Sussex who are searching for a peaceful, countryside home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Fox Inn in Guisborough, where hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison hope to impress their guests with their northern B&B.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Posh girl-about-town Liv Sargeant hosts the first party in Bath, and hopes to impress with her sophisticated evening, complete with black-tie dress code. However, her unusual choice of entertainment, and her undying love for Michael Buble, threaten to hamper her chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former raver Mel Lewis-Leger hosts the second dinner party in Bath, but her taste in music and a spicy Cajun menu prove off-putting for some of the guests. Meanwhile, cafe worker Becky Tyler becomes more sociable, until she decides to do an impression of one of her fellow diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Handyman Jon Wicheard hosts the third dinner party in Bath. Denis Verrier suspects the food will not be up to his exacting standards, and sandwich enthusiast Becky Tyler also doubts the meal will be a success. The prospect of a disco excites vegetarian and former raver Mel Lewis-Leger, but society girl Liv Sargeant dreads the thought of any form of forced entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cafe worker Becky Tyler hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Bath. The theme is a `Mad Hat' tea party, and she sets out to put on a menu of British classics, but the round of sandwiches for starters might prove too much for the diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Patriotic Frenchman Denis Verrier hosts the final dinner party in Bath, and hopes his experience of working in the hospitality industry will stand him in good stead. However, two of the guests are shocked by what they find in his wardrobe, and his staging of a penalty shoot-out provides more surprises, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef continues his quest to transform the fortunes of the Burger Kitchen in Los Angeles, where tensions were running high because owner Alan Saffron had spent his son's entire inheritance on the struggling restaurant. Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on This Morning and Doctor Who, and sing along to The Sound of Music.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: The popular 1990s game show returns - after last October's one-off revival as part of Stand Up to Cancer - for a full series, with comedian and film-maker Richard Ayoade stepping into the shoes of previous hosts Richard O'Brien, Edward Tudor Pole and Stephen Merchant. As the Maze Master, he will guide five intrepid celebrities - Ore Oduba, Vicky Pattison, Alex Brooker, Lydia Bright and Louie Spence - through the Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Future zones, where they play a range of skill, mystery, physical and mental challenges to win the all-important crystals. The more they win, the more time they have in the final test - the Crystal Dome.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: `Deadly' (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, he's shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. She's an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Archaeologist Sophie hopes Second World War enthusiast Mark will be the man for her. Also entering the romantic restaurant is comedian Kelly, who worries that she tends to intimidate men. Can high-flying entrepreneur Russell handle her banter? Plus, mum-of-four Heather, 72, hopes retired businessman Gary will keep her company in her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. He visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: Ewan has a surprise opportunity for wealth beyond his wildest imaginings, but there are strings attached as he finds himself on the horns of an unusual moral dilemma. Josh and Abi are attempt to be a normal couple by pretending that he isn't a millionaire, Watto realises that being poor doesn't make him a good person, and Leon comes to an understanding about the true value of money, and finally resolves his relationship with Case. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of an Italian restaurant in New Jersey, which is struggling due to a cumbersome menu, an unruly kitchen and confused staff. Gordon suggests carefully prepared meatballs will be popular with the clientele, but owner Joe Cerniglia needs to make some big changes.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr around the tasting table this time are First Dates' Fred Sirieix, food critic Giles Coren, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of smoked salmon, gin and the ready meal favourite lasagne. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test samples milk chocolate, something Brits spend around a billion pounds on each year.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Derby take part in the dinner competition, hoping to secure the £1,000 prize. First to host are engaged couple Nicky and Lee, whose attempt at a `posh' menu fails to impress Richard and Julia, who host on night two. Then, at the third party, Dave and Gemma are convinced their organisation in the kitchen will bag them the jackpot - but a guest's belly dancing threatens to overshadow their efforts.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: The Pickwicks staff in London try to secure deals on high-fashion footwear, while in Sheffield, London Road owner Dan takes in a multi-diamond deal from businesswoman `Botox Sue'.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan makes an offer on Susannah's silver tea set, and Ada's large bronze sculpture leaves him stumped. Meanwhile, at Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, owner Charlie finalises deals on an antique writing bureau and a diamond ring.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The house-hunters are in the West Country, where Phil Spencer meets a couple who are looking to put down roots after years of moving around the country because of the husband's job in the RAF. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp helps a newlywed couple who have £175,000 to spend on their first home. However, a chance encounter with a neighbour over a garden fence takes their search off in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps more home-buyers find a balance between town and country, including young couple Ayden and Pete, who are keen to escape the bright lights of Glasgow.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in at Ivanhoe Guest House in Bridlington, where Mick and Gill Jennings hope their simple approach will win the day. But Michael is quick to pick fault.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Clair Sherwood-Parkin hosts the first party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping to impress with a Moroccan-inspired feast. However, one guest causes a stir when she introduces herself as the Queen of Sheba, and Clair's party game unearths some shocking truths about her diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon James Emson hosts the second party in Darlington, Co Durham, and decides to accompany his curry main course with a gruesome contest in which he serves up a selection of eyeballs, tongues and other bits of offal, then challenges his guests to identify which animal they came from. Diner Barry l'Anson also manages to leave the party having achieved a lifetime ambition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barry l'Anson hosts the third dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and hopes his love-themed evening will endear him to his guests. Unfortunately for him Clair Sherwood-Parkin is not impressed and begins doubting the host's masculinity, and vet James Emson is concerned what the dessert will be like. Charlotte Langley finds herself wanting a sick bag before the evening is over, and Eseyoma Sodje steals the show during some cringe-worthy entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charlotte Langley hosts the fourth dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and asks her guests to attend dressed as their favourite red-carpet celebrity, but as the night progresses, she discovers she is not very good at taking criticism and a tense situation threatens to get out of hand.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eseyoma Sodje hosts the final dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping her Nigerian recipes and a hint of glamour will impress her guests. To further improve her chances of bagging the £1,000 prize, she puts on a round of hip-hop karaoke, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.sub-title: The Body in the Freezer: Countdown to Murder.
programme.desc: In March 2010, pub landlord Michael Tucker shot his partner Rebecca Thorpe in the head while she was having a bath and hid her body in a chest freezer in one of the outbuildings of his bar in Snettisham, Norfolk. This documentary analyses Tucker's emotional state of mind and the events that led him to kill in cold blood, and includes interviews with Rebecca's father Peter, Jes Fry of the Norfolk and Suffolk major investigation team and consultant forensic psychologist Kerry Daynes.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: The case of a London gang who murdered 17-year-old Marcel Addai after an ongoing feud on social media, which saw gang members threatening each other in homemade rap videos.(n)

programme.title: Murder on the Internet
programme.desc: Crimes involving dating apps have risen sevenfold in the past two years with more than 400 offences reported to police last year - including assault, rape, child sex grooming and even murder. This two-part documentary looks at some of the most shocking crimes committed by people using online dating as a way of finding their victims, revealing why greater public awareness of the risks of using such apps is needed.(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Robert Aldrich's classic drama stars James Stewart as Frank Towns, pilot of a plane transporting workers and cargo from an oilfield back to town. Caught in a sandstorm, the plane crashes hundreds of miles off its course, and the radio is destroyed. As the days go by, all hope of rescue fades - until Heinrich Dorfmann announces he is an aeroplane designer and, by cannibalising the wrecked plane, he can build a craft to fly them to safety. The outstanding cast also includes Richard Attenborough, Peter Finch, Ernest Borgnine, Ian Bannen and Ronald Fraser(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Harry experiences a bout of teenage angst as he harbours a crush on a fellow-student at Hogwarts. But a strange prophecy reveals itself, and Harry's wizard exams and raging hormones have to remain in the background as he is called into action once again(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Savory blend of comedy, drama and romance stars the captivating Catherine Zeta-Jones as a workaholic New York City chef who must deal with taking charge of her orphaned 9-year-old niece (Abigail Breslin) and a free-spirited coworker (Aaron Eckhart) who has intruded on her kitchen and, in typical opposites-attract fashion, found his way into her heart. The film is a remake of the 2001 German hit "Mostly Martha." Patricia Clarkson, Bob Balaban, Jenny Wade. Directed by Scott Hicks(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: In this raunchy yet heartfelt comedy, a commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must reevaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy fashion magazine(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Riotous campus comedy in which a lawyer unwittingly gives his thirty-something friends an opportunity to recapture their college years when he relocates to a local university. Having caught his wife cheating on him, the out-of-luck attorney finds his new house turning into a 24-hour party pad for a variety of misfit college students, middle-aged slackers and elderly retirees as he struggles to avoid being evicted by the new Dean of Students(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent goes undercover and infiltrates a group of extreme athletes in order to prove they are using their specialised skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. The film is inspired by the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in Roman Polanski's eerie thriller about a rare-book buyer who dabbles in the supernatural when he is asked by a millionaire (Frank Langella) to find a rare volume that enables the reader to contact the Devil. Lena Olin, Emmanuelle Seigner, Barbara Jefford, Jack Taylor(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: Denzel Washington plays a quadriplegic detective who tracks a serial killer from his home computer with the outside help of a gifted rookie cop(n)

programme.title: Sweet Dreams
programme.desc: Sweet Dreams stars Jessica Lange as country-western singer Patsy Cline, whose tragic death in 1963 cut short one of the most fabulous success stories in the annals of popular music. Robert Getchell's screenplay goes the usual route of contrasting Cline's rise to fame in the years between 1956 and 1963 with her turbulent private life. As the wife of hard-drinking Charlie Dick (Ed Harris),Cline is subjected to all manner of abuse and humiliation, yet she stays with Charlie long beyond normal human endurance. A happy second marriage is all too short-lived--as is Cline herself. While the Cline-Dick relationship is presented relatively realistically, the film makes a number of chronological errors concerning Cline's "public" life. Also: how can anyone know what was being said in the last horrifying seconds before Cline's fatal plane crash? Unlike its role model Coal Miner's Daughter (in which Beverly D'Angelo played Cline), Sweet Dreams does not feature the voice of its star during the musical scenes; instead, actual recordings of Patsy Cline, electronically enhanced to match modern technology, are heard on the soundtrack. Song highlights include "Crazy," "I Fall to Pieces," and the title tune(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Conservative Welton Academy is enlivened by the arrival of a charismatic English teacher who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: The film revolves around a tough cop named John Kimble who must take up an undercover assignment as a kindergarten teacher to find a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bob and Walt are inseparable - they're conjoined twins. But things start to come apart when Walt pursues his Hollywood dream(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust. Action(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Barry Levinson's comedy drama tells the story of manic forces radio DJ Adrian Cronauer hired to entertain the troops. His irreverent humour and madcap antics endear him to the grunts but bring him into direct conflict with his superiors. The film paints a broad picture of the conflict with Williams justifiably at centre stage in an achingly funny film(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: A Los Angeles journalist befriends a homeless Juilliard-trained musician, while looking for a new article for the paper(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Set in the Depression of the '30s in southern United States, this drama portrays the remarkable relationship established between Paul Edgecomb (Tom Hanks), a prison guard on Death Row, and John Coffey (Michael Clarke Duncan), a hefty colored man sentenced to death for a brutal double homicide. As the days go by, and after some surprising experiences, Edgecomb begins to have doubts about Coffey's culpability. He is a naïve, apprehensive man with a supernatural gift. Based on a novel by Stephen King, this drama received four Oscar nominations(n)

programme.desc: A chance for viewers to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett is assigned to protect billionaire entrepreneur Erik Vaughn after an attempt on his life fails, prompting Castle to worry the object of his affection might end up falling for her charge. Ioan Gruffudd guest stars, with Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl is found suffocated to death in Central Park, Briscoe and Green discover her adoptive mother's attempts to discipline the child may have inadvertently caused the tragedy. However, the case is thrown into confusion when a post-mortem reveals she may actually have died of an allergic reaction. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A high-school student is found dead in an apartment building, and Briscoe and Green suspect an improper website may have played a part in her murder. As McCoy and Southerlyn investigate the case further, they realise the victim's best friend, who was reluctant to come forward as a witness, may provide the answers. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Jesse L Martin and Elisabeth Rohm.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A government weapons truck is hijacked as part of a plan to allow a dangerous criminal to escape from jail. Two officers are killed, but as Horatio tries to prevent further carnage and rescue a hostage, it is the members of his own team who find themselves in the line of fire. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. The safe house is attacked, leaving Vance in hospital and Eli missing, with his bodyguard Amit Hadar dead. The movements of all the Palestinians are accounted for at the time of the attack, making it unclear who was responsible, and Ziva suspects her Mossad replacement Liat is hiding something. Drama, starring Michael Nouri, Cote de Pablo, Rocky Carroll and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: The town holds a charity bachelor auction, and Cedar Creek's women put in place a plan to win their chosen men. Meanwhile, Olivia is visited by her ex-husband who asks her to attend counselling with him, and Warren shares his plans for the waterfront's development.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Olivia reassures Jack that she doesn't have feelings for Stan, and that she is committed to building a future with him. Justine mulls Seth's request to move in together, but her mother isn't sure that it's the right decision. Elsewhere, Maryellen gets to know John better, but her fears about his past are not completely allayed when he turns down the offer of an interview.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the stabbing of a teacher whose body has been found in a caretaker's cupboard. The hunt for her killer leads to the discovery that she was caught up in a love triangle at school involving a student with multiple identities. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a female rock singer, who apparently died of an overdose of cocaine and heroin. However, their inquiry is hampered by the appearance of a retired officer using unorthodox research tactics to find out the truth. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man's mistress is found murdered, adding a further unpleasant dimension to his already acrimonious divorce - and before the CSIs can begin their investigation, another body turns up. A suspect is eventually identified, and the case goes to court, but a wily defence attorney manages to have Delko, whose evidence is vital, ruled unfit to testify.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A former serviceman who had been having an affair is beaten to death in his own back garden, and the agents are forced to consider the possibility that his wife - a US Marine and martial arts expert - is the killer. Meanwhile, McGee becomes the subject of an embarrassing mix-up when an inflatable doll apparently purchased on his credit card is delivered. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.sub-title: A Man Walks into a Bar.
programme.desc: The agents are forced to undergo psychological evaluations conducted by Dr Rachel Cranston (guest star Wendy Makkena) while investigating the death of a submarine's commanding officer. Suspicion falls on a journalist seen arguing with the man before his demise, and Tony discovers a link between the psychotherapist shadowing the agents and Ziva's predecessor Kate Todd. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Part two of two. The wealthy and powerful Mulroney family is investigated for links to the Mafia, and Stabler hunts for Helen Katich, the only witness to Brecker's death - but her lifeless body is found in a car pulled from a river. However, the setback leads to a Mob hitman who provides information needed to pursue a case against the family.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A sniper fires into a school playground, killing one pupil and wounding others before fleeing, leaving behind a rifle that is linked to a gun shop owned by the head of a neo-Nazi organisation. A suspect is eventually arrested - but Munch is shot during the ensuing trial. Starring Richard Belzer and Ice-T.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Building workers at a playground find the remains of a boy who disappeared more than 20 years previously, and when Stabler visits the school attended by the victim, a teacher tells him about the disappearance of four Puerto Rican children in 1978. As he investigates, a link is made to a case being worked on by lab technician Millie Vizcarrondo.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson is assigned round-the-clock security when sadistic killer William Lewis makes contact with her after escaping from his hospital prison guard. After murdering his doctor, he abducts and threatens to kill the woman's daughter unless Benson admits she lied during his trial - a confession that leads her to an abandoned granary, where the killer indulges in a devastating game of Russian roulette. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Pablo Schreiber.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinister and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: After turning up at Lindsay's house with his hands covered in blood, Justin claims he was in a bar fight - but Lindsay is certain there is more to the story. She decides to confide in Hank, but is swept aside as he focuses on an investigation into the death of a man who had links to the higher echelons of the criminal fraternity. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.desc: Severide's father Benny causes a stir as he returns to town. Taking an instant dislike to rookie Pete, he shows similar unease around Chief Boden, and it soon becomes clear that the former fireman once worked alongside Pete's dad, who died in the line of duty. Meanwhile, Shay decides to become a mother through artificial insemination in the aftermath of her split from Clarisse, and Casey makes an ill-advised choice in his date for the Fire Academy's banquet.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of an investment analyst whose dealings with a bankrupt company left many clients penniless. Overcoming initial problems with identifying the victim, they pick up on a clue that leads them to the dead man's attorney, who was apparently the last person to see him alive. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the stabbing of a college activist, whose knowledge of a beef supplier's poor sanitary conditions may have led to his death. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Delko is rushed to hospital with potentially fatal gunshot wounds, and Horatio waits anxiously as medics try to revive him, while the rest of the team searches for his assailant. Calleigh and Ryan process the crime scene, and question a security guard who provides them with what appears to be vital information - until further evidence sheds new light on the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy officer scheduled to testify in a forthcoming murder trial goes missing after receiving a threat at the safe house where he was staying, and the deputy district attorney asks the NCIS agents to locate him. One of their few leads is a dead turkey Tony and McGee find in the man's fridge, so they take it to Ducky for an autopsy. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Grace tries to put Will's actions behind her, while he makes big plans for the future. Elsewhere, Justine takes measures to make Seth more comfortable away from the boat, and Olivia is visited by Stan's current wife, who is worried that something is going on between the former couple.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Jack is offered his dream job in Philadelphia, and Olivia's ex-husband Stan reveals his plan to move back to Cedar Cove. Meanwhile, Maryellen investigates John's past by taking a trip to Tacoma, but her prying drives a wedge between them.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a struggling actress in what appears to have been a bungled robbery. When a couple produce a video tape showing the thieves at work, the detectives waste little time in tracking down their suspects. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two thieves discover the skeletal remains of a woman who was believed to have died in the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Centre. It transpires that a valuable and unusual ring has been stolen from the body, and the team suspects foul play. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach, Elisabeth Rohm and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio investigates an arson attack that looks like a case of revenge on an ex-lover and her new partner, leading him to meet Yelina. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine dies while saving the life of a foreign defence secretary, who was the target of an assassination attempt. Gibbs and the team are given the task of protecting the politician's daughter while she studies in America, but fail to stop her being kidnapped and ransomed in a bid to prevent her father signing an important treaty. Crime drama, starring Sean Murray and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine's teeth and fingertips are found in a pickpocket's stolen purse, and Ducky discovers he had been tortured on a rack before dying. The agents realise he may have been killed in error, and that the real target was his ex-girlfriend, a skilled player of computer games who unwittingly uncovered a mysterious code. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Sergeant Benson is rescued by the squad following William Lewis's death. However, her strife continues when her actions are investigated by the Internal Affairs department, and head prosecutor Derek Strauss calls for her arrest. Starring Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson goes undercover to meet a man suspected of raping three women he met through a speed-dating service. Guest starring Dean Cain, Veronica Cartwright and Teri Garr.(n)

programme.desc: A pregnant teenager is attacked and loses her baby as a result of the injuries she sustains - but during the team's search for her assailant, it gradually becomes clear that she helped to orchestrate events. programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Kristen Stewart stars in Catherine Hardwicke's adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's best-selling series of romantic fantasy novels about a teenage girl who falls in love with a vampire. When her mother remarries, Bella Swan moves to Washington State to live with her father Charlie. There, in the small, perpetually wintry town of Forks, she starts her new life, though she has no inkling of quite how different it's going to be. At her new school she quickly establishes herself as both a bit of a klutz and a hunk magnet. But she's not interested in most of the guys, apart from the moodily handsome, ashen complexioned Edward Cullen. And when he saves her from various threatening situations, their mutual attraction is sealed. There's just one problem: he's a vampire. But although Edward and his undead family are 'vegetarians' who don't feed on humans, his breed find it very difficult to control their overwhelming desire for human blood when their emotions switch from love to lust..(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: A brilliant and beautiful college professor makes a terrifying discovery about herself after experiencing a frightening blackout in the latest installment of the shocking Species series. Miranda Hollander (Helena Mattsson) is a genius who is about to discover just how little she truly knows about the universe. Upon awakening from a mysterious blackout, Miranda is horrified to find herself surrounded by a mass of mutilated human bodies. When Miranda approaches her uncle in hopes of discovering an answer to this disturbing development, she is shaken to learn that she is in fact a half-human/half-alien clone. Now, the only hope for Miranda is to flee to Mexico with her uncle and seek out the scientist who created her. But it won't be long before Miranda is unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with an endless horde of murderous hybrids on their trail, it's only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which a young woman who is half-human, half-alien goes on the rampage. Scientists have received a message from space which details the DNA structure of the alien race which has sent it, together with instructions on how to combine the alien DNA with that of a human being. Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. Growing up at an incredible speed, Sil is also developing some quite alien powers and presents a serious threat to the human population. A team of trackers - and assassins - has been despatched to eliminate her, but will they succeed before it is too late?(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters

programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths hidden gems at a recycling centre in Altrincham, including a collection of lab stools, an old electrical meter, and some worn fabric.(n)

programme.desc: Paul Martin and Irina Aggrey visit Redruth to collect items to sell at a street auction in aid of a deserving local resident who works hard to help others despite her own problems.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: New series. Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox return with a new series of topical reports and investigations, live from the programme's new home in Salford. In this episode, the hosts report on the alarming concerns surrounding smart meters in residential properties. Elsewhere, the team embark on an undercover investigation into a company that is training their new recruits to deliberately target elderly customers with products that they do not need, often costing thousands of pounds.(n)

programme.title: The Week the Landlords Moved In
programme.desc: A transformative series challenging some of Britain's most successful landlords to spend an eye-opening week living in one of their own rental properties. In the first episode, Essex-based landlords Marc and Peter are faced with some uncomfortable truths about the state of some of their rental properties, and self-made millionaire Paul experiences what it is like living in shared accommodation.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Lucy Porter, Romesh Ranganathan and Judge Robert Rinder competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at how the retailers compete in the market for healthier foods. Gregg Wallace discovers how one supermarket is using an exotic ingredient to reduce salt in burgers and heads to Germany to find out whether a new innovation could deliver alcohol-free wine that still tastes good. Babita Sharma investigates the technology required to create a wheat and dairy-free version of one of the nation's favourite dishes and gets to the bottom of the confusing world of health labelling.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: In a programme all about crime on the move, the team takes to the streets with Greater Manchester Police to expose driving offences that put cyclists' lives at risks on the roads.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit properties in Birkenhead, Paisley and Madeley Heath, Staffordshire, talking to their new owners about their plans.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The MERIT mobile trauma team are called into action to deal with a man who has been stabbed and hit in the head with a sledgehammer.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood investigates a car driver who deliberately staged a crash, slamming on his brakes so the van behind rammed into his vehicle.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams of firefighters select antiques to take to auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire, helped by experts Richard Madley and Catherine Southon. Tim Wonnacott presents.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha gets frustrated when she is not allowed to leave work to visit her mother, while Heston is banned from seeing bride-to-be Ruhma. PC Watson checks out a protest.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton is in the Cotswolds on an unusual house-hunting mission with a couple whose £900,000 budget needs to fund two separate homes under one roof.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three more items from the recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, with master craftsman Jay Blades revamping a discarded chair and artisan Norman Wilkinson using old floorboards to transform a chest of drawers.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Tim Weeks collect unwanted items from a neighbourhood in Matson, Gloucester, raising funds for a popular local man who suffers from narcolepsy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Johnny does his best to make things up with Derek and encourages him to reveal what is really going on. Robbie tells Sonia she needs to be honest with Bex if she expects her daughter to move in with her, Patrick feels guilty about Dot's accident, and Mick starts to relax as he makes the final preparations for Linda's return home.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Enforcement officer Alan Pennington heads to a scrap yard to recover money owed to a mechanic who was sold a faulty engine, and Sheriffs Lawrence and Kev face a very tricky problem as they deal with the repossession of a garage business. Meanwhile, Sheriffs Tommy and Craig take a High Court Writ to one of Britain's biggest and most famous companies - but how will they track down the right person who can make the payment that the company's former employee is owed?.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team helps a couple whose 24-year-old son Ryan has been living in hospital for the last five years, as they renovate the downstairs of their three-bedroom house in Bristol so he can move back home. The house needs a downstairs extension with all the bespoke care provision that Ryan will need, including physio space, a wet-room, a family area and the ability to access the entire ground floor, and if the family doesn't get this work done, Ryan will remain in hospital 50 miles away.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Hastings, East Sussex, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Linford Christie joins comedy star Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television that helped set him on the path to success as an Olympic sprinter, from the crazy kicks and amazing flicks of 1970s wrestling to the antics of Bob and Terry in The Likely Lads, via the world's first superstar footballer on and off the small screen.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: Paramedic Ste Hill blue lights it to the scene of a roadside accident where a motorcyclist has come off the road and collided with an electricity box on the side of the pavement.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as two teams search for antiques at the East of England Showground in Peterborough, with the help of experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 50th anniversary at Gardeners' World Live at Birmingham's NEC. Joe Swift and Adam Frost explore the show gardens and meet a designer who has created a garden showcasing 50 years of changing trends. Carol Klein looks at the plants that have defined the decades, while Rachel de Thame, Flo Headlam, Alan Power, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane explore other features of the event. Main host Monty Don catches up with predecessor Alan Titchmarsh to discuss the series, while Mary Berry reveals the winner of the golden jubilee plant award.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day three from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the third-round matches. Johanna Konta delighted the home crowd at this stage last year with a 5-7, 6-4, 6-0 victory over two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova, and Dominika Cibulkova continued her march to the title with a 7-6, 6-3 win against Kateryna Bondarenko. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Thomas Plant and David Fletcher select items to take to auction, including a masonic watch and a sought after commemorative mug by Eric Ravilious. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits the home of Britain's first Prime Minister, Robert Walpole.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts the panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke, with guests Vim Kumaratunga and Lindsey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Architect Piers Taylor and actress Caroline Quentin explore unusual homes built in or near areas of forest. After trips to properties near Madrid and the Catskill Mountains in New York State, they arrive in Piha, New Zealand, to a house built within an indigenous forest of pohutukawa trees. Navigating very strict environmental laws, this wooden-cladded and glass-roofed property mimics the branches of the surrounding trees, while its huge sliding glass walls open up to allow the surrounding forest to become an intrinsic part of the house itself.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Finals Main.
programme.desc: The finalists prepare their main courses, hoping to impress with some new and untested dishes. Judges Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and Oliver Peyton are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid, Paralympic gold medallist and winner of the first ever men's singles wheelchair event at Wimbledon, as they decide who has done enough to take their main course to the banquet.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Sudan: The Last of the Rhinos.
programme.desc: The remarkable story of Sudan, the very last male northern white rhino on the planet. Snatched from his mother's side in Central Africa, Sudan became a prized exhibit in a zoo while the rest of his kind were poached to near-extinction. This programme focuses on the desperate battle to bring his sub-species back from the brink of extinction, told through the characters who have been involved in his life.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: In a bid to get back everything he has lost, his marriage, his livelihood and self-worth, Vincent concocts a spectacular plot to return to his rightful place, with the help of local gangster, Ronnie Farrell. But before that, he has to pay off his massive tax bill. Meanwhile, when Carol makes a simple mistake, Fitzpatrick and Lavender must help save the day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: Cameras follow Glendon from Preston who has Glioblastoma, a form of brain tumour. He has identified an immunotherapy drug, and wants to self-fund a course, so he seeks advice at Charing Cross Hospital's private wing. Elsewhere in London, Nicky from Devon has travelled to Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital to receive NHS treatment not available at her local hospital for her ovarian cancer.(n)

programme.title: Jo Cox: Death of an MP
programme.desc: On June 16, 2016, Labour MP for Batley and Spen Jo Cox was assaulted and gunned down following a constituency surgery in Batley, West Yorkshire. Her attacker was Thomas Mair, a local man whose personal political views are said to have been antithetical to Cox's, and were thought to have driven him to murder. This documentary makes use of eye-witness testimonies to tell the story of the brutal attack that brought an end to the life of a passionate and ambitious parliamentarian. The film profiles her killer, presenting a portrait of a conflicted, contradictory man who volunteered to help people of all races, but harboured a secret obsession with Nazism and the extreme right-wing.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Strange Signals from Outer Space!.
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Weather presenter Carol Kirkwood joins Brian Conley to revisit favourite TV memories, including Starsky and Hutch, The Liver Birds and Play School.(n)

programme.title: A&E on the Road
programme.desc: The BASICS team treat two-year-old Ashanti, who has suffered a fit, while paramedic Kathryn Davies attends to a 15-year-old with Crohn's disease.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Kingston upon Thames, south west London, two teams of mothers and sons are challenged to pick up bargains at an antiques fair. Antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss are on hand to guide them towards turning a profit at auction as presenter Tim Wonnacott observes proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton presents the second semi-final, which begins with the teams having to create six perfectly uniform Buche Entremet, a large log-shaped sharing dessert, with multiple layers of flavours and textures. At the same time, they have to prepare all the elements needed for a live table-plated dessert, a three-minute piece of gastronomic theatre in front of judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin. In the final challenge, the teams are tasked to make a centrepiece made entirely from sugar, with one group making their way to the grand final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Tennis from Eastbourne
programme.desc: The AEGON International. John Inverdale presents coverage of day four from the Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club in Eastbourne, featuring the quarter-finals. Eventual champion Dominika Cibulkova recorded a hard-fought 4-6, 7-6, 6-3 victory over top seed Agnieszka Radwanska at this stage last year, and British number one Johanna Konta's run continued with a 7-6, 6-4 win against Ekaterina Makarova. With commentary by Sam Smith and Gigi Salmon. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Normanby Hall in Lincolnshire, where experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley value items brought in by the public, including traditional Troika and tribal artefacts, one of which brings a surprise for the owners at auction. Presenter Paul Martin returns to the city of Lincoln to visit the cathedral, and gets a unique look at a stained-glass window.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Steve Leonard and Miranda Krestovnikoff for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin visit an island in Norway, spending two days in a house built on a footprint of just 100 square metres. In Spain, the pair head to a home built into a steep cliff face overlooking the Mediterranean, featuring a cantilevered terrace offering maximum sea views and a swimming pool as well as an unusual tiled roof. After viewing a house in New Zealand crafted from two separate wooden cladded structures, the duo explore a home in Canada inspired by two ships in dry dock, designed to peer over the coast, allowing the sea to pass underneath.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.sub-title: Great British Menu: The Finals: Final Dessert.
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the finalists to get a dish in contention for the banquet and the chefs are going all out as they serve their dessert course. Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort are joined by tennis player Annabel Croft to judge the puddings, before selecting the final menu to be served at Wimbledon.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dawn of the Driverless Car.
programme.desc: Exploring the artificial intelligence required to replace human drivers, focusing on issues including the ethics of driverless car crashes and the impact on jobs. Despite the glossy PR and positives such as reduced exhaust emissions, the reality is that the future of driverless cars might not be all good news.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Nish Kumar and Romesh Ranganathan. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new journey following his Bradshaw's handbook from south-west Wales to Cambridge, beginning in Pembroke Dock, where Queen Victoria's royal yachts were built. In the little market town of Naberth he investigates what caused rebels to dress up as women, later spending the night at an inn in Carmarthen where Horatio Nelson once met Emma Hamilton. Next day, the former politician pitches in with the volunteers who look after the Gwili Heritage line and ends his leg in Swansea, where he learns how to pose for a photograph in Victorian style.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand explores what makes a great film soundtrack, and reveals that in the second half of the 20th century composers embraced jazz, pop and rock to bring new energy to movie scores. Using the 1960s as an example, he shows how the James Bond features, Italy's spaghetti westerns and Disney's musicals utilised the talents of composers such as John Barry and Ennio Morricone, before the role of a composer changed when directors like Martin Scorsese began to employ carefully chosen pop songs. With contributions from Richard Sherman, Lalo Schifrin and David Arnold.(n)

programme.title: Spies of Warsaw
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais' adaptation of Alan Furst's spy novel set in Poland, Paris, London and Berlin in the years leading up to the Second World War. It is 1937 and at the French embassy in Warsaw, new military attache Colonel Jean-Francois Mercier is drawn into a world of abduction, betrayal and intrigue in the diplomatic salons and back alleys of the city. At the same time, the handsome aristocrat finds himself in a passionate love affair with Anna, a Parisian lawyer for the League of Nations. Their complicated liaison intensifies as German tanks drive through the Black Forest. Starring David Tennant and Janet Montgomery.(n)

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr on Churchill: Blood, Sweat and Oil Paint
programme.desc: The broadcaster investigates Winston Churchill's lifelong love for painting and reveals the ways in which his hobby helped shape his career as politician and statesman. Andrew travels to the south of France and Morocco to discovers how the former PM's serious approach to the craft of led to friendships with major British artists of the 20th century, and he finds out how a single painting may have influenced the course of the Second World War.(n)

programme.title: Fighting for King and Empire: Britain's Caribbean Heroes
programme.desc: During the Second World War, thousands of men and women from Britain's Caribbean colonies volunteered to join the fight against Hitler, but their contribution has largely been forgotten. In this documentary based on the film Divided By Race - United in War and Peace, veterans tell their extraordinary wartime stories and reveal how they have faced a lifelong struggle to be treated as equals by the UK government and the British people.(n)

programme.title: Visions of the Valleys
programme.desc: Kim Howells examines how the natural splendour of the South Wales Valleys and the industries that grew up there have been a magnet for artists over the past 250 years. He begins with JMW Turner, who visited the Vale of Neath in the 1790s to paint the spectacular waterfalls, and reveals how the next generations of painters were more interested in industry and social issues, as brought on by the Great Depression and the Second World War. He also looks at the current crop of artists and how they portray the natural beauty that has returned to the valleys.(n)

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present the February 2 show, featuring Musical Youth, Queen, Matthew Wilder, Fiction Factory, Thomas Dolby, Thompson Twins, Juan Martin and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts the stories of Britain's castles and their roles in the country's history, art and literature. He begins by looking at the structure's first appearance during Norman rule in 1066, and then at the siege of Kenilworth Castle 200 years later, revealing how it was initially used as an instrument of invasion, but soon became a weapon with which unruly barons challenged the crown. He also visits Tintagel Castle in Cornwall, the place where King Arthur is said to have been conceived.(n)

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: The documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country focuses on Hokkaido, Japan's northernmost island and a place totally unlike the rest of the country. Every year it swings from a bitter Siberian winter into the warmth of a Mediterranean-like summer, with the thaw revealing a landscape changed beyond all recognition. It takes hardy animals and tough people with real ingenuity to survive in this ever-changing place. Michelle Dockery narrates. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Frank Skinner on Muhammad Ali
programme.desc: The comedian learns more about his hero, boxing icon Muhammad Ali, by visiting key locations and people in his life. In Ali's hometown of Louisville, Kentucky, he meets the boxer's brother Rahman and his former wife Khalilah, who was alongside him in the turbulent years when he was banned from the ring for refusing to fight in Vietnam. Frank also meets a bare-knuckle boxer from Oxfordshire who became one of Ali's dearest friends, and visits the Pennsylvania training compound where Ali and his team prepared for the Rumble in the Jungle. With contributions from Nicola Adams, Larry Holmes and Ali's business manager Gene Kilroy.(n)

programme.title: Boxing at the Movies: Kings of the Ring
programme.desc: Writer and critic Danny Leigh explores the elemental drama of the boxing movie, examining how each generation's fight films have reflected their times and been used to address powerful themes such as redemption, race and corruption. He asks why film-makers from Stanley Kubrick to Martin Scorsese have depicted tales of the ring, and interviews former undisputed world heavyweight champion Lennox Lewis, Rocky director John G Avildsen and Thelma Schoonmaker, editor of Raging Bull.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of
programme.sub-title: The Secret Life of Brothers and Sisters.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring sibling relationships in the first experiment of its kind in the UK. Filmed during a family camping holiday in the woods, the programme follows a group of children as they take part in tasks including a hay bale race, family drawings, and building exercises. Scientists observe their every move in a bid to learn about the dynamics between brothers and sisters, including how they interact and encourage each other, how they cope with younger siblings, and how they support each other in times of need.(n)
