The first episode focuses on Leah Washington and Joe Pugh, whose lives were turned upside down then when the roller coaster ride they were on crashed into an empty carriage, leaving the pair with devastating life changing injuries.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the BB companion show, including celebrity fans' thoughts on the latest developments in the run-up to tomorrow's eviction and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: It's a Hard Knock Life.
programme.desc: People getting by on benefits in the Midlands. Thirty-year-old Derby man James believes his bipolar disorder prevents him having a regular job His dream is to be a full-time entertainer - will his alter ego Mrs Plonker help him into spotlight? Plus, a part-time cleaner who wants to become a model and a former publican whose type 2 diabetes is hindering her search for work.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: As the strand returns, RSPCA officer Anthony helps Timmy, a neglected elderly collie cross who is found in a house surrounded by his own mess with a huge tumour on his face. Meanwhile, Inspector Helen meets Archie, a stroppy shih-tzu whose fur is so matted he can barely see or hear.(n)

programme.title: Shock Docs
programme.desc: One-off documentary exploring some of Britain's most bizarre parent-child relationships, where the mums and dads will do anything to look better than their kids. Those featured include 39-year-old Georgina, who was once a frumpy mum but has now followed daughter Kayla by becoming the image of a Barbie doll, complete with fake boobs and lips. Forty-five-year-old Paul is constantly muscling in on the action with his 18-year-old bodybuilder son Kyle, and former glamour model Charmaine loves flaunting what she has, much to the embarrassment of 14-year-old Yasmin. But when she decides to go back to modelling, how will her daughter react?.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice helps a Worcestershire couple sell their country cottage, which has been on the market for more than a year. She thinks their pet parrots might be discouraging prospective buyers - but needless to say, they are reluctant to get rid of them.(n)

programme.title: House Busters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis and her team of new-age practitioners suggest ways in which changes to homes could positively affect the lives of their owners.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: A young weasel finds a new home, a family of blue tits is rescued, and a heron is released.(n)

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Bump struggles to survive Mr Stubborn's swamp tour, while Mr Grumpy has a bumpy ride with Miss Chatterbox and some scaly friends.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The little rabbit accidentally breaks Kerry's bagpipe. She leaves Lee and Sioux with a promise that they will not tell Kerry, while she goes for help.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit drives Peppa's family to Granny and Grandpa's house to drop off their shopping, and then lends her services to everyone else.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Tidy Up.
programme.desc: The youngster grows tired of having to tidy away her toys.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Gold is discovered in Adventure Bay, but Mayor Humdinger and the Kit-tastrophe Crew soon find a chance to make off with it.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: As the team builds a fitness trail for the city fun run, Scoop decides to organise a sporting tournament for himself and the rest of the machines.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Station officer Steele claims to know all about the ocean and offers to help Charlie catch some fish, but he proves useless at the task.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Gordon is horrified to be put in charge of Whiff's Waste dump for the day.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Leah and her genies find themselves trapped inside a cave.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Wonky Toys.
programme.desc: The toys visit Fuse's workshop for a check-up, but they are all wonky when they come out.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Zuma feels left out when he cannot assist in a mission involving a trio of circus hippos. The pups spring into action when three hippos knock down a circus tent.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Barnaby elf's uncle Redbeard loses all his treasure, prompting Holly and Ben to follow the clues in an effort to track it down.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Grumpy is carrying a mysterious box up to the highest hill in Applecross. Digby and Chips do their very best to help. (S1, ep 20).(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa spend a day on the river in the company of Granny and Grandpa.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Monty the Meerkat asks Wissper for help, but he does not seem too sure what his problem is.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The friends set off to find some dinner after all of their carrots disappear.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: The day's news comes under scrutiny from Matthew Wright and the panel, with viewers and the studio audience invited to share their opinions.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro helps a man who wants to move to Australia - but first he has to sell his West Yorkshire home, which has no shortage of space but needs tidying up to attract buyers.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Another argument leads Zac to the conclusion that his marriage is over, while Leah tells Irene she wants to sell her share of the diner. Olivia finds Hunter's DNA test results.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Shane steps in when Aaron's sales pitch to a potential investor goes awry, Finn tries to justify himself and Ben overreacts when he hears Yashvi and Luke gossiping about Xanthe.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a navy intelligence commander responsible for tracking the movements of a Venezuelan politician disappears. Concerned the abduction may lead to a future assassination attempt, the special agents race to find the missing officer, while protecting the foreign dignitary's life.(n)

programme.title: Left to Die: The Sandra & Tammi Chase Story
programme.desc: A woman takes a holiday in Ecuador, but ends up arrested for drug trafficking and incarcerated in a brutal prison. Her daughter devotes herself to getting her released, facing a lengthy battle with bureaucracy and a foreign legal system she knows nothing of. Fact-based prison drama, starring Barbara Hershey and Rachael Leigh Cook. Edited for violence.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Shane steps in when Aaron's sales pitch to a potential investor goes awry, Finn tries to justify himself and Ben overreacts when he hears Yashvi and Luke gossiping about Xanthe.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Another argument leads Zac to the conclusion that his marriage is over, while Leah tells Irene she wants to sell her share of the diner. Olivia finds Hunter's DNA test results.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: An episode combining new and unforgettable past cases. The High Court Enforcement Agents head to Manchester to track down over £5,000-worth of debt, and seize an expensive car in the process. Later in south London, the agents deal with a violent debtor who threatens them with a concealed weapon, and in Liverpool, they are met with lies and aggression from a mechanic who owes nearly £3,000.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: In Sickness and in Wealth: On Benefits.
programme.desc: North West claimants struggling against medical and psychological issues while getting by on benefits. Blackpool martial arts enthusiast Mark hopes to get back into paid employment after being dismissed for breaking a colleague's nose, while Liverpool couple Clive and Sheila want to tie the knot on a benefits budget. Autistic Fleetwood man William struggles to get round due to a bad back and varicose veins. He needs a mobility scooter but has benefits have been cut.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest eviction, revealing which of this week's nominees the public have voted out, then chatting to them about their time on the show, who they think voted for them and why they feel it was their time to go. But before that, there's the question of seeing how they've all been getting on in the regular round-up.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal discusses tonight's eviction, asking the panel whether the public made the right decision, talking to Emma Willis and meeting the unlucky ex-housemate.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.sub-title: Big Brother: Live from the House.
programme.desc: Live streaming action, picking up with the hopefuls to reveal how they are getting on since saying goodbye to another housemate in tonight's eviction.(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Conservative Welton Academy is enlivened by the arrival of a charismatic English teacher who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: This well-acted, introspective sports drama follows Miguel (Algenis Perez Soto), a talented Dominican baseball player longing to break into the American big leagues in order to provide financial support for his family. While paying his dues in the minors, Miguel experiences a variety of cultural and language barriers despite the kindness of his host family. After an injury he must contemplate his role in the world as well as baseball. Rayniel Rufino, Andre Holland(n)

programme.title: The Big Chop
programme.desc: A girl's love for her afro begins to wane as she grows up and is subjected to teasing by her family and friends. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster is put through the wringer by suspense director David Fincher ("Seven") in this taut thriller. When thieves break into their Manhattan brownstone, a single mother (Foster) and her daughter hide in a high-tech, fortified "safe room." But as it turns out, the money the crooks are after is in that room. Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Dwight Yoakam, Jared Leto(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Director Richard LaGravenese's romantic drama stars Hilary Swank as Holly Kennedy, a New York real estate agent forced to come to terms with the unexpected death of her young husband Gerry. Before he died, Gerry wrote her a series of letters, to be delivered across the forthcoming year, hoping to help her grieve. The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: In this offbeat love story, a woman falls for an oddly principled hit man who kills anyone who hires him to commit murder. While she believes she's finally found the perfect guy, their romance is threatened by an FBI agent who's hunting her new beau(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Courtroom drama in which two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: Vietnam War drama about an elite combat unit of four hundred soldiers preparing to face two thousand North Vietnamese fighters in a small clearing in an area later known as the Valley of Death. Adapted from the book We Were Soldiers Once. . . and Young by Lt Gen Harold G Moore(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A plane crash leaves a compulsive workaholic stranded on a deserted island for more than four years, where he's forced to adjust to a new life of solitude(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded country town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Ripping, fact-based profile in chutzpah about the U.S. congressman who, in the 1980s, used his influence to supply Afghan fighters with money and arms in their battle against Soviet occupiers(n)

programme.title: How High
programme.desc: The Ivy League will never be the same in this crazy comedy about two underachieving stoners who finagle their way into Harvard with the help of a strain of weed that conjures up their deceased brainiac friend(n)

programme.title: On Time
programme.desc: A woman who is running late for a job interview is forced to make a tough decision. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War vet Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a young Hmong teenager, who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: his 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the nerve-shredding third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, an ex-cop who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: Cop Brian O'Conner goes undercover in LA's dangerous street- racing underworld to snare hard-driving car criminal Dominic Toretto(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Riveting docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Grand Visions is a short season of films driven by the vision and boldness of strong directors; passion projects made on a grand and uncompromising scale. The season kicks off with director Baz Luhrmann's western/ war adventure/ romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. It's soon obvious that she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: This intense and unnerving thriller should make viewers' skin crawl. Ashley Judd stars as an Oklahoma waitress who's battling her own addictive demons. She takes on a whole new set of problems when she gets involved with an unhinged Gulf War vet (Michael Shannon) who's wracked with paranoid delusions involving invasive insects and clandestine military experiments. Directed by William Friedkin and written by Tracy Letts, who adapted his stage play. Harry Connick Jr., Lynn Collins(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate consultant must determine the fate of a mysterious artificial being called Morgan, which has begun evolving at a faster rate than anticipated. When Morgan attacks one of her creators, the group surrounding her are pressed to make a decision(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: In this spooky and surreal chiller, an American movie producer (Anastasia Hille) searching for her birth parents inherits a house in Russia that holds dark and dangerous secrets from her past. Directed by Nacho Cerda(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: The tumultuous life of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risked her life's savings to produce and market her invention of the Miracle Mop. The success of that invention sparked her television-shopping business empire(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Conservative Welton Academy is enlivened by the arrival of a charismatic English teacher who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Sugar

programme.sub-title: Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Jewbilee. As all of South Park waits for the meteor shower to begin, Kyle and Ike go into the wilderness for a Jew Scouts Jewbilee. Kenny tags along and takes on the king of the woods..(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: A Cappella Club. Sketches include a terror outfit operating a food truck; a college a cappella group getting a new member; Meegan and André going on their first date; a PSA that helps prevent child soldiers in Africa; and two old men discussing popular music(n)

programme.desc: Foam. Amy confronts her therapist about her mother; falls in love with her barista; and loses her head(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Big Bird. During a morbidity-and-mortality conference to determine who should be held responsible for a patient's death, J.D. and Turk recall leaving Sacred Heart to track down a cured patient (Jason Bateman) who owed J.D. a thank-you. Also, Elliot reveals how she got mixed up with a married man and his vengeful wife; and Carla explains how she organised a lottery pool. Mrs. Wilk: Michael Learned. Millie: Allison Smith(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Half-Acre. Mandy Moore plays someone who has the potential to be J.D.'s perfect love match; Elliot offers J.D. relationship advice and tries to help break his bad habit of ruining romantic moments by uttering really inappropriate things. Elsewhere, Turk lip-synchs in an "air band" made up of Sacred Heart regulars; and Carla encourages Dr. Cox to treat a Jehovah's Witness patient. Jordan: Christa Miller. Ted: Sam Lloyd. Lonnie: Michael Hobert(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Her Story II. When Carla begins to feel old, she drags her friends to a college club. Meanwhile, J.D. lets the little things bother him with Julie. This episode is narrated from Carla's viewpoint(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Buddy's Booty. A favourite patient is at death's door. Each of the staff finds their own way to deal with it - booty calls, new drinking buddies and the hospital gym are all welcome distractions(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Cabbage. J.D.'s dislike for and resentment toward intern Keith (Travis Schuldt) increase to the point where J.D. tries to get him dismissed from Sacred Heart, but the plan backfires. Elsewhere, Elliot and Turk misplace their patient's deathbed statement to his children; and the Janitor attempts to keep a pet bird in the hospital without Dr. Kelso knowing it. Mrs. Wilk: Michael Learned. Jason: Shaughn Buchholz(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Five Stages. J.D. and Dr. Cox surprisingly turn to each other for support as they face losing their favourite patient. The Janitor and Ted team up to give Dr. Kelso a taste of his own medicine(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Spread Your Wings. Fez sets out to create his dream life, with the help of Isaac Hayes. A gift from Kitty makes Donna think twice about dating Randy(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Son and Daughter. Hyde's dad goes out of town and leaves Hyde with the responsibility of looking after his house while he's gone. The gang wants to have a party; the party gets a little out of control, and one of W.B.'s prized possessions is damaged. Kitty does some soul-searching and discovers the real reason behind her objections to Donna dating Randy(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Keep Yourself Alive. Coming home from the local fair, Kitty's engagement ring accidentally goes out the window. Red leaves the kids on the roadside to find it while he takes Kitty home. While looking for the ring, Donna and Randy try to spend some time apart from the others; Fez makes a new friend after going off on his own. Once back in the comforts of home, Kitty finds out the truth about her ring(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: My Fairy King. An unexpected visitor leads to a shock for Hyde. Meanwhile, Jackie looks for love and Red makes a major life decision(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Crazy Little Thing Called Love. Jackie turns to Donna for help; she needs to know what to do about her feelings for Fez, and ends up going to a therapist for advice. When Jackie finds out that she only loves men who are not available to her, she's happy... until Fez becomes available, and Jackie finds herself still wanting him. Hyde tries to help Red accept his new role as a retired man by keeping him busy around the house(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: We Will Rock You. While Jackie and Fez attempt to stop a disco record-burning, a gay couple moves in next door to Red and Kitty(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

So Red and Hyde decide to sell the pills to the guys at Red's Viking Lodge(n)

programme.title: New Girl

programme.desc: When Sophie takes Max and Caroline shopping for bridesmaids' dresses, the girls enlist their friends' help to hide the ugliest outfits in the hope of avoiding humiliation.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline's attempt to help Nash become a success in the modeling business comes to a halt when his mother arrives from Ireland to take her son home.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurant's bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Rules of Engagement

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Ryder and Mel come to an agreement, and Joe offers his help after Mel's attempt to teach Lennox how to drive does not go down well. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey

programme.title: Baby Daddy

programme.title: Baby Daddy

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: New Girl

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Cece receives an exciting new job offer, so Jess agrees to help with the wedding preparations - but things do not go to plan when Schmidt's dad appears. Peter Gallagher guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howard's hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesn't stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadette's disapproval.(n)

programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Penny's living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the lives of the many sharks that inhabit the sea, which include the great white, tiger and hammerhead.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines why the most intelligent animals on the planet are also the most social. Swimming with a pod of dolphins in the Bahamas, he explores their language and learns how they are able to recognise themselves in a mirror. He also witnesses the deviousness of chimpanzees and watches elephants as they mourn their dead.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Zookeeper Giles Clark faces a serious problem when, at two months of age, the tiger cubs he has been hand-rearing show signs of outgrowing his home.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of homes to animals, not only as a place to live but as a shelter from the elements and a refuge from enemies. A pack of African hunting dogs have made their home on a vast plain in Zambia, but it's far from safe as they must battle hyenas and protect their young. Hermit crabs on a tropical island settle down in empty snail shells - and when a new property washes ashore, they all form a queue, then move up the housing chain until all the shells are taken. On the edge of the Sahara are chimpanzees, whose survival relies on knowing where to find water in the most extreme droughts. Here the elders lead a troop on a brutal trek to a dried-out riverbed to dig wells.(n)

programme.desc: The rangers face danger as they try to introduce a defensive sun bear back into the wild.(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Coral Canyon
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the hunting behaviour of sharks, including footage of nighttime hunting, as well as the link they share with coral reefs.(n)

programme.title: Operation Wild
programme.desc: Broadcaster Clare Balding and vet Steve Leonard travel the world to watch vets perform innovative life-saving operations on a variety of wild animals. This first edition features a baby panda called Zhu Xia in south-west China that needs an MRI scan, and rescued gorilla Shufai in Cameroon, who was shot by poachers when he was a baby. Plus, a manta ray on the Japanese island of Okinawa that needs an ultra-sound scan to determine if it's pregnant, and a four-ton elephant in Laos with a gunshot wound.(n)

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: As Giles Clark's adopted tiger cubs begin to grow into their maturity, the time arrives for them to leave his home and return to Australia Zoo. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of power in the animal kingdom, revealing how dominant creatures have the best access to food and water, and are also the most attractive to the opposite sex. An orphaned young chimp tries to climb the social ladder, but his troop is ruled by big, aggressive males and his first attempt to join them ends in a beating. A meerkat society will only allow newcomers in if they know how to deal with a venomous snake. And the only way to occupy the top spot in a meadow of kangaroos is to beat the ruling male in a boxing match - but few have challenged the current incumbent, who stands at 8ft. Will any animal dare take him on? David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Coral Canyon
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the hunting behaviour of sharks, including footage of nighttime hunting, as well as the link they share with coral reefs.(n)

programme.title: Frontier Borneo
programme.desc: David McGuire sets out to move a group of sharks to a new home, and activist Alex Yee goes undercover to try and expose the dark secrets around the trade of turtle eggs.(n)

programme.desc: An incoming storm and a recent death threaten to derail a planning mountain-climbing event on Mount Kinabalu.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Comedian Bill Bailey narrates a documentary examining the lives of an eccentric cast of unconventional and unusual creatures that do things differently, turning this oddness to their advantage, such as the parrot that has forgotten how to fly, the bear that has turned vegetarian and a penguin that lives in the forest.(n)

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: A haunting tale of a widow with psychic powers who gets involved in a murder mystery(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: Ricki is an aging rock-n'roll-loving woman who abandoned her family in order to chase her tattered dream of becoming a famous rock star. Now, she is given one last chance to set things right when her ex-husband, Pete, asks her to visit her estranged daughter, Julie, in Chicago(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Brennan Huff, a sporadically employed thirty-nine-year-old, lives with his mother, Nancy. Dale Doback, a terminally unemployed forty-year-old lives with his father, Robert. When Robert and Nancy marry and move in together, Brennan and Dale are forced to live with each other as step brothers. As their narcissism and downright aggressive laziness threaten to tear the family apart, these two middle-aged, immature, overgrown boys will orchestrate an insane, elaborate plan to bring their parents back together(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: This stylish, moody and absorbing spy thriller takes a behind-the-scenes look at the cloak-and-dagger doings of the CIA, focusing on the conflicted emotions of a Yale graduate who is recruited by the top-secret government organization(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two U.S. Marines in WWII are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher(n)

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace
programme.desc: Young couple Chris and Lisa Mattson are terrorised by their new neighbour, racist cop Abel Turner(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh directs Disney's 2015, live-action take on the classic fairy tale Cinderella, which stars Lily James as the put-upon young women forced to endure a life of labor at the hands of her stepmother (Cate Blanchett) after her father dies unexpectedly. Forced to do every menial chore imaginable, Ella maintains her good spirits and eventually strikes up a friendship with a stranger in the woods who turns out to be the prince. When the royal court holds a gala ball, Cinderella wants nothing more to attend, and although her stepmother won't allow it, she gets help from a surprising source(n)

programme.title: Bolt
programme.desc: The canine action star of a hit TV series, who actually believes he has superpowers, accidentally winds up in New York City and must find his way back to Hollywood, so he recruits a streetwise alley cat and a hero-worshiping hamster for his cross-country trek(n)

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: Comedy about an out-of-work actor who dresses in drag for an audition, only to land the female lead in a television soap. When he becomes the most popular character on the show, he feels compelled to carry the persona into everyday life. While bringing him phenomenal success as an 'actress', life as a woman also has its problems - especially when he falls for a real actress with whom he works(n)

programme.title: Wayne's World
programme.desc: Mike Myers and Dana Carvey play the hosts of Wayne's World, a cult cable show. But slimy TV executive Rob Lowe has plans for the programme and for the babelicious Tia Carrere(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Brennan Huff, a sporadically employed thirty-nine-year-old, lives with his mother, Nancy. Dale Doback, a terminally unemployed forty-year-old lives with his father, Robert. When Robert and Nancy marry and move in together, Brennan and Dale are forced to live with each other as step brothers. As their narcissism and downright aggressive laziness threaten to tear the family apart, these two middle-aged, immature, overgrown boys will orchestrate an insane, elaborate plan to bring their parents back together(n)

programme.title: I Still Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Bloody sequel to the 1997 horror hit finds coed Julie James and her new best friend encountering terror while on a weekend getaway at an island resort(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: Beatrix Kiddo aka "The Bride" was once part of a group of elite, top class female assassins, until the group leader, "Bill", and the other assassins turn against her and leave her for dead. Five years later "The Bride" wakes up from the coma the assassins left her in and begins her quest for vengeance. She works her way down the list of her ex-colleagues leaving her boss Bill for last. Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned…(n)

programme.title: The Hitcher
programme.desc: Horror remake about a young couple who become embroiled in a bloody battle of wits with the psychotic hitchhiker they stop to pick up on their way home for spring break. The hitcher is a brutal serial killer who decides to set up the young driver as the fall guy for a string of horrific murders as part of a macabre game of cat and mouse(n)

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
programme.desc: Six years after Dumb and Dumber, Jim Carrey reunited with Peter Farrelly and Bobby Farrelly for this anarchic comedy with a hint of romance. Charlie (Carrey) is a good-natured Rhode Island state trooper who likes helping people. But years of internalizing his frustrations about his work and his family have caused Charlie to develop an alter ego: Hank, an abusive, violent, sexually compulsive police officer. Charlie can keep Hank at bay with medication, but just barely. When Irene (Renee Zellweger) finds herself in legal trouble through a series of misunderstandings involving her ex-boyfriend, Charlie must escort her on a long drive to New York for questioning. After Charlie loses his medication, he and Hank wind up vying for her affections: Charlie wants Irene to marry him, while Hank has more brutal intentions. Me, Myself, and Irene also features Chris Cooper, Robert Forster, and Jessica Harper, as well as Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee, and Jerod Mixon as Charlie's rotund, African-American sons(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in Marc Forster's violent, fact-based drama about a substance-addicted criminal who finds God and relocates to Sudan to offer his own idiosyncratic brand of Christian charity. The film initially portrays Sam Childers as being a far from nice man: a misogynistic biker whose life is steeped in crime, narcotics and violence, and who quickly returns to armed robbery almost as soon as he's released from jail. But while he was inside, his wife Lynn found Jesus, and, after Sam gets stabbed, she urges him to join her at church. Sam subsequently has his own Damascene moment and starts life afresh, founding his own (legitimate) construction company. Before long he has also built his own church. But it's only after a trip to Sudan, where he witnesses the devastation wrought by the marauding Lord's Resistance Army, that he truly becomes driven. Relocating to the African country, he sets up a faith-based centre to care for victims of the LRA's violence and rape. And also takes up arms to literally fight the good fight... Also starring Michael Shannon(n)

programme.title: A Simple Plan
programme.desc: Three men discover a crashed plane containing $4.4 million in stolen money and scheme to make off with the loot, but as the plan starts to unravel, so do the men's lives(n)

programme.title: Cinderella

programme.title: Bad Company
programme.desc: A man takes his dead twin brother's place as a CIA operative in order to trap a gang of nuclear arms terrorists. But the ruthless criminals learn of the deception and kidnap his fiancee. : Joel Schumacher(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorizes a summer resort town, where a police chief, a grizzled fisherman and an intrepid marine biologist realize they're "gonna need a bigger boat" to battle the bloodthirsty beast. An Oscar winner for sound, editing and John Williams' score(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Just when Mrs. Brody thought it was safe, a great white shark follows her to the Bahamas after killing her son(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Action-adventure starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a former special agent who reluctantly returns to duty when his daughter is kidnapped by a gang of right-wing extremists(n)

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: When a Miami-mob loan shark is sent to LA to collect a debt from a producer of low-budget films, he pitches him an idea for a picture instead of breaking his legs. Pretty soon the shark finds himself in his element with criminal predators of the Hollywood variety. This clever adaptation of Elmore Leonard's novel features cameos from Harvey Keitel and Bette Midler, and a sparkling score from John Lurie(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: Earthquake
programme.desc: Spectacular effects are the attraction in this melodrama about people caught up in earthquake(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: This program salutes the legendary filmmaker who, during World War II, ran the Field Photographic Branch, a unit that shot a raft of documentaries that captured "the scope and sprawl of World War II." Kris Kristofferson is the narrator. Included are comments by Hollywood directors Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich; and critics Leonard Maltin, Andrew Sarris and Richard Schickel(n)

programme.title: Hudson Hawk
programme.desc: Before The Da Vinci Code there was Hudson Hawk, an action comedy starring Bruce Willis as an international cat burglar who is duped into stealing priceless works of art by Leonardo Da Vinci. Unbeknown to him, the paintings contain hidden codes that reveal how to invent a machine that converts lead into gold, and his mystery benefactors plan to use it for world domination. Fun from start to finish, this has now become a firm cult classic. Also starring Andie MacDowell, Richard E Grant and Danny Aiello(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: A glossy high-tech, futuristic sci-fi exterior does little to conceal the fact that this gory actioner is little more than a cliche-ridden prison movie--a movie that found tremendous popularity internationally. Set amidst an overpopulated, oppressed future U.S., it centers on the struggles of a defiant young couple who decide to have a second baby after the first dies. Unfortunately, the law states that each woman can only have one child. It is irrelevant whether the child survives or not. The couple attempts to make it safely out of the country, but they are captured and sentenced to spend three decades in the dreaded, corporate-owned Fortress, a grim place where lasers replace iron bars and inmates are controlled via radio-operated pain-inflicting intestinal devices. Incorrigible prisoners are forced to have their identities erased by a "mind wipe" machine. The prison is controlled by a sadistic cyborg warden and a robot army. The warden wants to make the woman's baby into a cyborg too. The warden also finds the wife very attractive. Meanwhile the husband begins making friends with his cellmate in hopes of finding a way to disable the surveillance system in time to save his wife and somehow escape(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Three murders during a city-wide blackout result in a joint investigation by Adrian, Sharona, Stottlemeyer and Disher, with the co-operation of the FBI and a power company spokeswoman. All the evidence points to a well-known radical, but there is one small snag - he died in 1995. Detective drama, guest starring Judge Reinhold (Beverly Hills Cop) and Alicia Coppola (Jericho).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The agents track down the killer of a man who believed he was abducted by aliens, and the case becomes more complicated when his body is stolen from the coroner's van. Van Pelt takes time off from the investigation to shop for a wedding dress. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The owner of an exclusive dating website is murdered, and although Jane is certain the victim's wife is to blame, she is released due to a lack of evidence. When holes begin to appear in her alibi, the consultant discovers a way to convict her of the crime, while the rest of the team learns that some of the women at the agency are filming their encounters with wealthy men so they can blackmail them. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team travels into Oregon wine country to steal a rare bottle of vintage as part of the current con against the greedy owner of a winery. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton and Gina Bellman.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: The team creates a global toy craze to take on a CEO who is about to release a dangerous product onto the market. Drama, starring Timothy Hutton.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tracks Bodnar's SUV to a remote house in the countryside, but inside find only his dead accomplice - identified as a South African mercenary who helped Bodnar procure diamonds. Ziva and Tony, meanwhile, discharge themselves from hospital and wheedle information out of Abby to continue investigating on the quiet, having been warned by Homeland Security to stay off the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A cook from a US Navy destroyer tells McGee and Gibbs he believes someone is stalking him with the intention of trying to make him poison the crew, and a picture on a stolen phone leads the team to a group testing the psychological effects of surveillance. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks (Gus Grimly in the Fargo TV series).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane deals with two failed robberies, one resulting in the murder of a repair shop owner, and the other involving a former suspect the consultant hired to break into LaRoche's home. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects that a state prison inmate is to blame for the murder of a guard who was stabbed to death outside a jewellery shop, and Rigsby decides to find out what his criminal father knows about the killing. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: Leverage
programme.desc: Nate takes on a case linked to his son's death, and leads the team into their riskiest con to date. He knows the mission puts the squad's reputations - and health - on the line. He relates to Ellen the brief to steal `The Black Book', a record of all illegal transactions made by bankers and wealthy businessmen that led to the financial crisis of 2008.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates when Navy Seal Chad McBride's wife receives a package from Riyadh in Saudi Arabia containing her husband's severed head, which Palmer discovers contains very high levels of radiation. McBride's commanding officer reveals the soldier was on a top-secret reconnaissance mission and asks Vance not to disclose the details to anyone. Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American crime drama returns with the team still reeling from the Department of Defence investigation, with Ziva, McGee and Tony having handed in their badges. Parsons continues his inquiries into Gibbs and his agents, but events take a turn when an explosion kills the Secretary of the US Navy and seriously injures the director of Homeland Security. When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Comedy drama series based on the early days of talk show host Phil McGraw, when he was an expert jury consultant. Starring Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A meeting with a successful former schoolmate inspires Peter to make his mark on the world, while Chris is discovered by an influential art dealer and goes to New York to pursue a career as a painter. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Mila Kunis and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg grows tired of being constantly embarrassed by the rest of her family and secretly books them to appear on Diane Simmons' daytime talk show - where they prove so popular that the network offers them their own reality TV series. Animated comedy, with the voice of Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine's adoptive parents visit for an unannounced holiday with the family, and Stan becomes angry when they refuse to fall in with his `man of the house' attitude. Steve tries to impress a girl at school by living to the extreme.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan uses CIA brainwashing techniques to stop Hayley leaving for France, but realises he will face deadly consequences unless he relinquishes his power over her. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger become private detectives.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A heatwave hits Quahog, and Peter enters Brian in a dog show in the hope of winning enough money to buy a new air-conditioning unit. However, the erudite canine feels humiliated and runs away from home - only to find himself hauled off to the pound and sentenced to death.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois's wealthy aunt dies, leaving the Griffins her Rhode Island holiday home - but the family feels uneasy living in luxury. Peter takes lessons to become a debonair gentleman and ends up inadvertently giving away his new-found wealth. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan sets up a date for Deputy Director Bullock with Francine's friend Melinda and gets everyone drunk to ensure they have a good night - but he is forced to take drastic action when he receives some grisly news the morning after. Featuring the guest voices of Patrick Stewart and Ally Walker.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: When a Stan Loves a Woman.
programme.desc: Stan discovers Francine has a memorial garden to ex-lovers and starts to fear their marriage is falling apart - prompting her to ask for a divorce. Meanwhile, Steve becomes addicted to an energy drink.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's favourite police drama is cancelled, so he tries to persuade a publicity-hungry TV executive to put it back on the air by claiming that Chris is dying. As news spreads of the youngster's `illness', well-wishers mount a candlelit vigil outside the house.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois runs for the position of school board president but refuses to overturn a decision to sack a teacher, prompting Peter to compete in the election and launch a smear campaign against her. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Alex Borstein and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan becomes a traffic warden in a bid to be taken more seriously, and suddenly finds himself caught up in allegations of corruption and favouritism. Hayley poses nude for a college art class and is surprised to see Roger is one of the students.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan prays for a friend and is delighted to have his request fulfilled - until he learns his new pal is an atheist, at which point he sets out to prove that God exists by making his acquaintance's life extremely hard. Meanwhile, Roger convinces Steve that he has been accepted into Hogwarts.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Members of the Northern California Symphony Orchestra come under suspicion when a violinist is murdered, and Cho encounters a young pickpocket. Crime drama, starring Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part series finale, a bank robber's suicide bombing outside a petrol station convenience shop leaves Jane suspecting there is more to the case than meets the eye. The incident is linked to the discovery of the body of a torture victim, and it transpires he was related to Hightower - who appears to be the target of serial killer Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.desc: Brian goes to collect Stewie from Lois's parents' house in Palm Springs - but the duo lose their plane tickets in an airport bar, and find themselves with no choice but to stow away on board a train back to Quahog. Meanwhile, the Griffins try to spice up their marriage.(n)

Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

Fact-based drama, starring Tyrone Power and Maureen O'Hara.(n)

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.desc: Drummond is outraged when he is replaced by a woman, and Piglet is determined to see him reinstated.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: One of Our Naughty Bits Is Missing.
programme.desc: Tim's decision to donate a book to the local men's ward is hampered by the neighbourhood tramp, and then by mother. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy worries she has a stalker when she spots someone following her home at night. Lionel's efforts to calm the situation are unsuccessful, so Alistair steps in to help and manages to uncover the mysterious man's identity.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: Beware the Trickster on the Roof.
programme.desc: The Meldrew household falls foul of an evil curse, so Victor resolves to remove it. However, it soon becomes clear the task is easier said than done. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Rights of Man (Except for Howard).
programme.desc: Hobbo tells Howard to stand up for himself if he still wants Pearl to take him back - but his wife pours cold water on his attempts to impress her. Marina decides to seize the moment with Mr Waddle, and the police pull Tom over for driving too slowly, only to end up sharing his bacon sandwiches. Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. Meanwhile, Toby's attempt to regain Monica's affections is thwarted by a dog, and Marina decides to dress down for a change. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wondering if Pearl still loves him, Howard asks Hobbo to give her a peck on the cheek from him - only to become even more despondent when he sees his wife deliver a passionate kiss. Meanwhile, Glenda sends Barry off to paint a landscape, hoping the activity will distract him from his hunger - but fish and chips is the only thing on his mind. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.sub-title: One of Our Naughty Bits Is Missing.
programme.desc: Tim's decision to donate a book to the local men's ward is hampered by the neighbourhood tramp, and then by mother. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett and Barbara Lott.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: Beware the Trickster on the Roof.
programme.desc: The Meldrew household falls foul of an evil curse, so Victor resolves to remove it. However, it soon becomes clear the task is easier said than done. Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: How Not to Cry at Weddings.
programme.desc: In the final episode of Roy Clarke's long-running comedy, everyone prepares for the wedding - prompting Howard and Pearl to look back at their relationship. Meanwhile, Alvin flirts with Stella, Toby tries to smarten himself up in a bid to win back Monica, and Clegg worries he has forgotten something important.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature.
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an `Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright invents a saint's day as a pretext for checking the pockets of a foreign visitor suspected of shoplifting. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Julian Clary, Omid Djalili and Reginald D Hunter.
programme.desc: Host Omid Djalili warms up the audience before camp comic Julian Clary and Alabama's finest Reginald D Hunter take the mic at the Hammersmith Apollo in London.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy seems reluctant to reveal any information about her new boyfriend, Mark refuses to talk about why his wife has thrown him out, and Dermot lies to his fiancee's parents about his job - all of which makes Agnes feel her family is becoming too secretive. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy tries to impress Toni with his new job in a music studio, while Mark is disappointed at being passed over for promotion. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dubious transvestite Emily hits the town with her friend Florence to celebrate her last night as a single `laydee'. Dudley is unimpressed by the arrival of Ting Tong's mother, and Sid Pegg calls an urgent Neighbourhood Watch meeting when he learns a rogue caravan has moved into the area. Comedy sketches, starring Matt Lucas and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: It is 1485 and Edmund, Duke of Edinburgh's accidental killing of his great-uncle Richard III at the Battle of Bosworth Field leads to his father becoming king. However, he also manages to help his family's arch-enemy to escape - and meets faithful sidekick Baldrick for the first time. First episode of the comedy, guest starring Peter Cook, with Rowan Atkinson and Brian Blessed.(n)

programme.sub-title: Julian Clary, Omid Djalili and Reginald D Hunter.
programme.desc: Host Omid Djalili warms up the audience before camp comic Julian Clary and Alabama's finest Reginald D Hunter take the mic at the Hammersmith Apollo in London.(n)

programme.title: Vic Reeves Big Night Out
programme.desc: Vic sees a new side to Wavy Davy, the Stotts present a film review and Graham Lister tries to take over.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill's TV Burp
programme.desc: The Bafta-winning comedian reviews the week's TV highlights, subjecting the latest soaps, reality shows, documentaries and other assorted oddities to his unique brand of scrutiny.(n)

programme.desc: The big-collared comedian looks back at the week's small-screen highlights, subjecting the latest soaps, reality shows, documentaries and other assorted oddities to his unique brand of scrutiny.(n)

programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil's belief that guests are an obstacle to the smooth running of his hotel is borne out by the arrival of an aggressive woman (Joan Sanderson), and the tension between the two leads to a series of increasingly heated arguments. programme.desc: Del and Rodney reluctantly agree to let Grandad accompany them on their holiday abroad - a decision they come to regret. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Lennard Pearce.(n)

programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Secret Birthday of Norman Clegg.
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Gavin Hinchcliffe Loses the Gulf Stream.
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson.(n)

programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom finds himself suffering a bad back during harvest time, which leaves Barbara to do all the work on her own - a situation made worse by the terrible weather. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark thinks a funeral is the perfect place to take Sophie on a date, while Jeremy gets friendly with a group of Christians, leading the pair to conclude that death and illness are the keys to a successful romance.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Sir Norman Fry is forced to explain an embarrassing incident with a glace cherry in Little Fumble. programme.title: School of Golf
programme.sub-title: KPMG Women's PGA Championship Special from Olympia Fields Country Club
programme.desc: KPMG Women's PGA Championship Special from Olympia Fields Country Club. Martin Hall and Blair O'Neal are headed to Olympia Fields Country Club to teach the short game shots the LPGA's best face in the KPMG Women's PGA Championship. There is also a special lesson with five-time major champion Phil Mickelson on what makes him one of the greatest of all-time with a wedge. Numerous LPGA players in the field stop by to share how they prepare for a major venue, and no trip to the Chicago area would be complete without a lesson in dealing with Windy City conditions(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The four chefs from Monday's heat who have yet to face their skills test are challenged by Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace to prepare potato gnocchi and serve it with a garnish or sauce of their choice. They then recreate Michel Roux Jr's dish of roast John Dory with artichoke barigoule, as well as a classic dish of their own choosing, before Monica and Michel decide which three contestants will advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The second quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult Palate Test, recreating John Torode's chicken liver pate with onions Madagascar and melba toast, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and critic Charles Campion - himself a former chef - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The host explores sustainability among fishing communities in the Philippines' Visayan Islands.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels the southern and eastern Mediterranean to explore its cuisine. He begins his journey in Marrakech, Morocco, tasting its wide variety of street food and soaking up the atmosphere of Jemaa el-Fna square, the city's largest communal dining area. Inspired, he returns to his rooftop kitchen and prepares a barbecued leg of lamb with almonds and orange blossom sauce, and herb-infused couscous with grilled cherry tomatoes, before meeting the Berbers, the country's indigenous people, in the Atlas Mountains.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal explores the history of the classic British pudding. He heads back to the early 1600s, when the way to make one was by stuffing the ingredients into an animal's intestine. The chef creates a rice pudding that looks like a hotdog, with a white chocolate mousse bun, pastry-fried onions, sweet soy sauce and saffron mustard, and makes a 17th-century pud involving a cow's udder. He also attempts a giant sponge pudding from the Victorian era and serves it to a specially invited group of teachers and dinner ladies.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 11 remaining bakers are given the task of creating a quiche that reflects their personalities, before tackling the technical challenge - tarte au citron. The pressure proves too much for some, as they try to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef

They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and critic Charles Campion - himself a former chef - and it had better be good, as for some of them, it will be their last time in the MasterChef kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Island Feasts with Peter Kuruvita
programme.desc: The host explores sustainability among fishing communities in the Philippines' Visayan Islands.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Costa Brava.
programme.desc: Along the Catalonian coastline, the chef uncovers some local foodie secrets, before she returns home to make leek parcels with a Romesco sauce.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including salmon, cuttlefish, chocolate and aubergine. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics Jay Rayner, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the third heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their calling card, a single plate of food that represents who they are, followed by the invention test, in which they prepare a dish in one hour from a choice of two sets of surprise ingredients. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing dinner for 2006 MasterChef winner Peter Bayless, 2012 finalist Andrew Kojima and 2011 semi-finalist Jackie Kearney. It's then down to the judges to decide who will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore what Britons ate during wartime and discover how some of the UK's favourite dishes have evolved from rationing. The duo also meet army cooks to find out what troops on the front line eat today, and prepare rabbit stew and carrot cake.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi's culinary journey takes him to Istanbul, where he tastes fish from the waters of the Bosphorus, shops for vegetables and samples the street food. Inspired by what he sees, he prepares Turkish pizza topped with spicy beef, pine nuts and a crunchy salad by baking it in a traditional stone oven, before cooking a casserole bursting with prawns, squid, tomatoes and cheese. He also visits a factory to help make baklava, one of the country's most popular desserts.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal delves into the history of iconic British dishes to find inspiration for a culinary salute, beginning with a three-course pie banquet. For his starter, he learns about the `surprise' pies of the 17th century and a dwarf boy who would jump out of one at a grand feast. Heston prepares a gala pie made up of beetroot and horseradish ice-cream in place of meat, with goat's cheese panna cotta, saffron and bacon, and the main course is a gothic affair inspired by Sweeney Todd. The chef also sets out to make the lightest ever mash with an attempt to change the molecular structure of a potato. The dinner is served to a select group of pie-makers 100ft in the air over the East End of London.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood reveal who will leave the competition. It's then down to the judges to decide who will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson rustles up more of her favourite recipes, this time with the emphasis on cosy and comforting mood. For breakfast she makes a tray of dairy-free chai muffins, while there's a low-key lunch of Asian-flavoured short ribs - a perfect make-ahead, tender beef stew. Inspired by her visits to America's west coast, an informal supper for friends features Nigella's home-made, oven-baked fish tacos, which involve a bit of DIY at the table, followed by a salted chocolate tart for pudding.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook
programme.sub-title: Rachel Khoo's Kitchen Notebook: Cosmopolitan Cook: Provence.
programme.desc: Tarte Tatin is one of the dishes on the menu as the chef celebrates French cuisine in rural Provence. She also pays a visit to a cheese-maker.(n)

It's then down to the judges to decide who will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)
